result.title: Chiral emissions report
result.description: Deliverable Chiral emission studies reportDelivered by MPGThe portable standalone CCP prototype developed by JGU will be used by the MPG group to perform field studies of chiral emissions It is possible that the device will allow studying chiral emissions from single trees in a insitu and timedependent fashion which can be used to correlate the chiral emissions with external factors such as light changes infestation and more The MPG group is preparing a permanent GCTOFMS station for ecology studies in the Amazon rainforest and it is possible that our CCP prototype can be added to perform studies of chiral emissions

result.title: High sensitivity body-fluid measurements
result.description: Deliverable High sensitivity body fluid measurements reportDelivered by UOCThe ability to perform chiral analysis in microscopic quantities demonstrated in deliverable 20 will be used to perform ultrasensitive chirality studies in body fluidstissues In deliverable 20 a sensitivity of 1ngml is targeted which will be enough to analyse and detect chiral drug traces in blood and other body fluids andor tissue

result.title: CCP with HPLC
result.description: Deliverable Combination of CCP with HPLC reportDelivered by UOCThe HPLC method is a widespread tool for modern analytical chemistry and medicine HPLC can perform stoichiometric analysis in solution without however being able to distinguish between two enantiomers of a chiral substance In this deliverable we will investigate the incorporation of a CCP device to an HPLC device with the aim to perform stoichiometric and chiral analysis simultaneously a step which will be important in the process of commercialization of the CCP technology
